title: Authors and Citation
text: . Marcia Barbosa. Author, maintainer. Neftali Sillero. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Barbosa .M. et al. 2024. ecotrends. https://github.com/AMBarbosa/ecotrends
code: @Manual{,   title = {ecotrends: Temporal trends in ecological niche models},   author = {A.M. Barbosa and N. Sillero},   year = {2024},   url = {https://github.com/AMBarbosa/ecotrends}, }

what: Temporal trends in ecological niche models
title: Temporal trends in ecological niche models
text: goal ecotrends compute time series ecological niche models, using species occurrence data environmental variables, map existence direction linear temporal trends environmental suitability, Arenas-Castro & Sillero (2021). package part MontObEO project.

title: Temporal trends in ecological niche models
text: can install ecotrends GitHub :

title: Temporal trends in ecological niche models
text: ’ll need species presence coordinates. code downloads example occurrence data GBIF, performs just basic automatic cleaning: also delimit region modelling. can provide spatial extent polygon – e.g., biogeographical region within species less evenly surveyed. Alternatively additionally, can use getRegion function compute “reasonably sized” area around species occurrences: Now let’s download variables build yearly time series ecological niche models species region. can first use varsAvailable function check variables years available, getVariables function download ones choose. Mind download may take long time: variable raster layers given pixel size Equator, actual pixel sizes can vary widely across latitudes. , let’s check average pixel size study region, well spatial uncertainty values occurrence coordinates: can see several occurrence points spatial uncertainty larger pixel size, might good idea coarsen spatial resolution variable layers: much closer spatial resolution many species occurrences. can now compute yearly ecological niche models occurrences variables: Let’s now compute model predictions year: Finally, can use getTrend function check linear (monotonic) temporal trend suitability pixel: Positive values indicate increasing suitability, negative values indicate decreasing suitability time. Pixels value significant linear trend.
code: library(geodata) library(fuzzySim)  occ_raw <- geodata::sp_occurrence(genus = "Chioglossa",                                    species = "lusitanica",                                    fixnames = FALSE)  occ_clean <- fuzzySim::cleanCoords(data = occ_raw,                                     coord.cols = c("decimalLongitude", "decimalLatitude"),                                     uncert.col = "coordinateUncertaintyInMeters",                                    uncert.limit = 10000,                                     year.col = "year",                                     year.min = 1970,                                     abs.col = "occurrenceStatus",                                     plot = FALSE)  occ_coords <- occ_clean[ , c("decimalLongitude", "decimalLatitude")] library(ecotrends)  reg <- ecotrends::getRegion(occs = occ_coords)  plot(reg, col = "wheat") points(occ_coords, cex = 0.3) ecotrends::varsAvailable()  vars <- ecotrends::getVariables(vars = c("tmin", "tmax", "ppt", "pet", "ws"),                                  years = 1990:1981,                                  region = reg,                                  file = "variable_rasters")  # or, after you've downloaded the variables with the above 'file' argument: # vars <- terra::rast("variable_rasters.tif")  names(vars) plot(vars[[1:6]]) sqrt(ecotrends::pixelArea(vars))  summary(occ_clean$coordinateUncertaintyInMeters, na.rm = TRUE) vars_agg <- terra::aggregate(vars, fact = 2)  sqrt(ecotrends::pixelArea(vars_agg)) mods <- ecotrends::getModels(occs = occ_coords,                               rasts = vars_agg,                               region = reg,                               collin = TRUE,                               file = "models") preds <- ecotrends::getPredictions(rasts = vars_agg,                                     mods = mods,                                     file = "predictions")  plot(preds) trend <- ecotrends::getTrend(rasts = preds,                               alpha = 0.05)  plot(trend,       col = hcl.colors(100, "spectral"),       main = "Suitability trend")

what: ecotrends: Temporal trends in ecological niche models — ecotrends-package
title: ecotrends: Temporal trends in ecological niche models — ecotrends-package
text: package computes temporal trends environmental suitability obtained ecological niche models, based set species presence point coordinates predictor variables.

title: ecotrends: Temporal trends in ecological niche models — ecotrends-package
text: Maintainer: . Marcia Barbosa ana.marcia.barbosa@gmail.com Authors: Neftali Sillero

title: Example dataset — exampledata
text: just example dataset

title: Example dataset — exampledata
text: data frame 30 rows 2 columns: x Random numbers 0 1 y Random numbers 0 1

title: Example dataset — exampledata
text: dataset simulated

title: Get everything (package wrapper) — getEverything
text: Get everything (package wrapper)

title: Get everything (package wrapper) — getEverything
code: getEverything(occs, vars = "all", years = 1979:2013, region = NULL, res = 5)

title: Get everything (package wrapper) — getEverything
text: occs species occurrence coordinates (2 columns order: x, y LONgitude, LATitude) object coercible data.frame (e.g. data.frame, matrix, tibble, sf object SpatVector points), coordinate reference system 'rasts' vars character vector names variables use - see varsAvailable() years year range model time series; default 1979:2013 region optional SpatExtent SpatVector polygon delimiting region 'rasts' within compute models; see ?getRegion suggestions res spatial resolution (pixel size), larger original variable raster layers', case terra::aggregate() used

title: Get everything (package wrapper) — getEverything
text: . Marcia Barbosa

title: Get models — getModels
text: function computes maxnet::maxnet() ecological niche model per year, given set presence point coordinates yearly environmental layers.

title: Get models — getModels
code: getModels(   occs,   rasts,   region = NULL,   nbg = 10000,   nreps = 1,   collin = TRUE,   file = NULL,   verbosity = 2 )

title: Get models — getModels
text: occs species occurrence coordinates (2 columns order: x, y LONgitude, LATitude) object coercible data.frame (e.g. data.frame, matrix, tibble, sf object SpatVector points), coordinate reference system 'rasts' rasts (multi-layer) SpatRaster variables use models. layer names form 'varname_year', e.g. 'tmin_1981', output getVariables() region optional SpatExtent SpatVector polygon delimiting region 'rasts' within compute models; see getRegion() suggestions nbg integer value indicating maximum number background pixels use models. default 10,000, total number pixels modelling region less. nreps integer value indicating number replicates compute model. One 1 implemented currently. collin logical value indicating whether multicollinearity among variables reduced prior computing model. default TRUE, case collinear::collinear() function used, default values species presences 'response'. file optional file name (including path, including extension) want output list model objects saved disk verbosity integer value indicating amount messages display. default 2, maximum number messages available.

title: Get models — getModels
text: list model objects class maxnet

title: Get models — getModels
text: . Marcia Barbosa

title: Get predictions — getPredictions
text: Get predictions

title: Get predictions — getPredictions
text: rasts (multi-layer) SpatRaster containing variables (names) used models mods list maxnet model objects, output getModels() file optional file name (including path, including extension) want output rasters saved disk verbosity integer value indicating amount messages display. default 2, maximum number messages available.

title: Get predictions — getPredictions
text: multi-layer SpatRaster predicted values variables year

title: Get predictions — getPredictions
text: . Marcia Barbosa

title: Get region — getRegion
text: function suggests region building ecological niche model around given set species occurrence point coordinates. Mind region consider survey effort, geographical barriers factors also taken account delimiting region modelling.

title: Get region — getRegion
text: occs species occurrence coordinates (2 columns order: x, y LONgitude, LATitude) object coercible data.frame (e.g. data.frame, matrix, tibble, sf object SpatVector points) type character indicating whether use "mean" pairwise terra::distance() among points (default), proportion "width" (minimum diameter, computed terra::width()) points' spatial extent prop type="width", proportion width use terra::buffer() radius. Default 0.5 crs coordinate reference system behind coordinates 'occs', one following formats: WKT/WKT2, authority:code (e.g. EPSG:4326), PROJ-string notation (see terra::crs()). default EPSG:4326, .e. unprojected longitude-latitude coordinates geodetic degrees, datum WGS 1984.

title: Get region — getRegion
text: . Marcia Barbosa

title: Get trend — getTrend
text: function uses terra::app() apply Kendall::MannKendall() function pixel multi-layer time series SpatRaster, testing monotonic (either increasing decreasing) trend raster values.

title: Get trend — getTrend
text: rasts multi-layer SpatRaster output getPredictions(), another time series values detect trend alpha numeric value indicating threshold significance level Kendall's tau statistic. Default 0.05

title: Get trend — getTrend
text: SpatRaster layer pixel Kendall's tau statistic (positive increasing, negative decreasing), NA trend non-significant (.e., 2-sided p-value larger specified 'alpha').

title: Get trend — getTrend
text: . Marcia Barbosa

title: Get variables — getVariables
text: function downloads specified time series variables specified environmental data source, optionally (save download time) within specified region. Currently "TerraClimate" (Abatzoglou et al., 2018) implemented data source.

title: Get variables — getVariables
code: getVariables(   source = "TerraClimate",   vars = varsAvailable(source)$vars,   years = varsAvailable(source)$years,   region = c(-180, 180, -90, 90),   file = NULL,   verbosity = 2 )

title: Get variables — getVariables
text: source source import raster variables , e.g. "TerraClimate" (currently one implemented) vars character vector names variables imported. Run varsAvailable() options. default download available variables specified 'source'. Note download can take long time, especially many variables, long series years, /large regions. years year range get variables (e.g. 1979:2013). Note download can take long time long series years. region optional length-four numeric vector (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax geodetic coordinates degrees), SpatExtent SpatVector polygon delimiting region world variables downloaded. See ?getRegion suggestions. larger region, slower download. file optional file name (including path, including filename extension) want downloaded rasters saved disk, case saved compressed multi-layer GeoTIFF verbosity integer value indicating amount messages display. default 2, maximum number messages available.

title: Get variables — getVariables
text: multi-layer SpatRaster

title: Get variables — getVariables
text: Abatzoglou, J.T., S.Z. Dobrowski, S.. Parks, K.C. Hegewisch (2018) Terraclimate, high-resolution global dataset monthly climate climatic water balance 1958-2015. Scientific Data, 5, Article number: 170191. doi: 10.1038/sdata.2017.191(2018). Database URL: https://www.climatologylab.org/terraclimate.html

title: Get variables — getVariables
text: . Marcia Barbosa

title: Make a scatterplot of two numeric variables — make_scatterplot
Average pixel area — pixelArea
text: function uses terra::cellSize() function compute (optionally map) area covered (optionally non-NA) pixel raster map; computes either mean centroid pixel area map, idea pixel size region. Pixel size can vary widely across latitudes, especially unprojected longitude-latitude rasters, also rasters projected non-equal-area coordinate reference systems.

title: Average pixel area — pixelArea
code: pixelArea(rast, type = "mean", unit = "m", mask = TRUE, map = TRUE)

title: Average pixel area — pixelArea
text: rast SpatRaster compute pixel area type character value indicating whether output value "mean" (default) "centroid" pixel area unit numeric value indicating units output value: either "m" (default) "km" squared. mask logical value (default TRUE) indicating whether consider areas non-NA pixels map logical value (default TRUE) indicating whether also plot map

title: Average pixel area — pixelArea
text: numeric value

title: Average pixel area — pixelArea
text: . Marcia Barbosa, wrapping 'terra' functions Robert H. Hijmans

title: Average pixel area — pixelArea
code: r <- terra::rast(system.file("ex/elev.tif", package = "terra"))  pixelArea(r)  #> Mean pixel area (m2): #> 556338.997876857 #>  #> [1] 556339  pixelArea(r, unit = "km")  #> Mean pixel area (km2): #> 0.556338997876857 #>  #> [1] 0.556339
